intro: Selago mcclouniei, commonly known as the Texas starburster, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences that resemble starbursts. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun, making it well adapted to arid environments. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink and purple, bloom in late spring to early summer. Selago mcclouniei is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
